title: Corrie's Katie McGlynn says Sinead's death felt 'like watching someone else die'
text:

Emotional Coronation Street actress Katie McGlynn admitted “I didn’t feel like I was watching myself, it’s like someone has died” as millions saw her soap character Sinead Osbourne take her final breath tonight.

The young mum has been battling cervical cancer and viewers watched this week as she recorded tearful video messages for her baby son Bertie to watch when he is older.

In heart-breaking scenes tonight, she passed away as husband Daniel (played by Rob Mallard) was reading a story to Bertie, only to look up and realise his wife was gone.

Grieving actress Katie, who had said earlier this month that her real-life parents would find the scenes too much to watch, said: “It was so sad because we’ve developed the character for six and a half years and I feel like I know her. She’s gone now so watching her final days, I don’t feel like I’m watching myself, I feel like I’m watching her. It’s really sad. I feel like someone has died.”

(Image: ITV)

On her Instagram page, Katie said: “If anything, Sinead’s storyline has taught me to appreciate the small things in life. When she puts her hand out the window to feel the rain for the last time, it really made me appreciate everyday things that we all take for granted.

“I really appreciate everyone sharing their own personal stories with me, my heart goes out to each and every one of you. We only get one life so make sure you live it.”

She also gave her “heartfelt love and gratitude” to fans for their support during her “seven wonderful years on the cobbles”. Sinead was diagnosed with cervical cancer last year while pregnant with her son Bertie but delayed treatment until after the birth.

Last month she and husband Daniel received the devastating news nothing more could be done for her.

The illness took hold of her this week before she had time to go to a hospice as planned. Katie, 26, admitted the scenes had made her think about her own life.

(Image: PA)

She said: “You’ve got to tap into them emotions in order to get yourself there. I just feel like it was real from start to finish so when you go home you can’t switch off. For my life personally how it’s changed, I don’t want to be cheesy but I don’t take life for granted as much as I did, I’ve been a bit more emotional with my friends and family.

“Life is not a fairy tale, sometimes soaps and TV tends to do the happy ending and I thought if we’re doing the story we need to do it properly to raise awareness. I hope people who’ve been through similar find it cathartic.”

Corrie bosses worked closely with charities Mummy’s Star and Jo’s Cervical Cancer Trust on the storyline and have been praised for raising awareness of the issue. Most of this week’s episodes were filmed over two weeks in a set of Sinead’s bedroom built specially for them.

Katie and Rob Mallard, who plays her husband Daniel, found it easy to feel emotional once the cameras were rolling on the new set.

Rob said: “We had such an emotional attachment in that room, when you were in there you were immediately back where you left it before. It wasn’t difficult to get into, if anything it was difficult to not just cry, it felt very real. ”

Katie added: “We felt like somebody had actually died.” Following Sinead’s death, Rob’s character Daniel faces difficult decisions - he shared a kiss with Bethany Platt days before his young wife’s death.

He argued with Sinead about the relationship but she forgave him. A confused Bethany is keen for their friendship to continue.

Rob said: “He has Bertie to focus on, Sinead has told him all these things, forgive himself and all of that, but it’s all caught up in the death.

“He now has to unpick all of that, the meaning and the message of what she said and actually apply it. But with the trauma and shock, you get away from that as quickly as possible. There will be changes in Daniel.

“He’ll have to untangle all of those emotions. Because him and Bethany share a guilt, and there’s a Sinead attachment to that, he doesn’t know what he wants from her.

“I’m not sure whether he needs to forgive her, or whether he wants her to forgive him, or if he wants to say that Sinead forgave both of them.”
description: The soap star says seeing herself acting her Coronation Street character Sinead's heartbreaking cervical cancer plot-line felt like watching a real person die
